alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lunenburg, Nottoway, west central Dinwiddie, Amelia, southwestern Powhatan and northwestern Brunswick Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chula to near Spainville to near Fort Pickett. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blackstone, Kenbridge, Mannboro, Amelia Courthouse, Nottoway, Jetersville, Wilsons, Fort Pickett, Morven, Scotts Fork, Chula, Macon, Spainville, North Wellville, Irby, Earls, Murdocks, Forkland, Darvills and Winterham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Western Chesterfield
